selected_quotes: We found no evidence that folic acid supplements reduced the incidence of mood disorder. A double-blind RCT.
Folic acid supplementation for prevention of mood disorders in young people at familial risk: a randomised, double…
NUTRITION: Folic acid supplements for prevention of mood disorders in young people at familial risk.

citation.abstract: Clinical mood disorders often become clinically manifest in the later teenage years and early twenties and can be associated with a poor long-term prognosis. The primary prevention of these disorders would therefore have great public health value. Nutritional supplements are a feasible intervention for primary prevention and several epidemiological studies have indicated links between low folate status and depressive symptomatology in the general population.
citation.title: Folic acid supplementation for prevention of mood disorders in young people at familial risk: A randomised, double blind, placebo controlled trial

blogs.title: Folic acid for depression: RCT finds no effect on reducing incidence of depression or bipolar
blogs.summary: Elly O'Brien summarises a recent RCT of folic acid for depression, which explores whether mood disorders can be prevented in young people at familial risk. The trial finds no evidence that folic acid supplementation reduces the incidence of mood disorders
